description:
I loved this tool when I used it under the X11 display server, but found that it didn't work (per the "screen covered in shutter logos" comments) once we switched to Wayland. This is because Wayland enforces security to prevent one application from capturing another application's content.

An alternative is to use Gnome's built-in keyboard shortcuts to capture images, then some other tool to actually edit & save them:

PrtSc = Capture screen
Alt+PrtSc = Capture Active App/Window
Shift+PrtSc = Capture Area
summary: Great for X11, but won't work under Wayland

description: I have been using Shutter for a few years and it has been great, but (I am not sure when) it started to lock up when I try to take a screen shot of a VirtualBox VM.

I need an easy to use, day to day tool for taking screenshots. This is perfect. I just needed to create a keboard shorcut so now I'm able to capture a rectangular area of the screen, while is saved to the clipboard and a file. It is incredible how hard is to find a tool that accomplishes such a "basic" functionality for a screenshot tool.
This app is a little bit slower than others to start running (2 secs maybe?), but as for now, is the only tool I found to do what I want at least with KDE.
It's easy to use, and very customizable
summary: Has all the features you'll need

description: Llevo usando shutter durante más de 5años y nunca me ha fallado

I don't understand all the one star reviews listed unless everyone simply forgot to set a star rating when giving a review ... doesn't make sense to me. 
My review is simple, I needed something to capture screens but not the entire screen. I needed something I could window a capture, paste it to something like a document & email it. 
Shutter met my expectations admirably & then went beyond with the ability to save the capture directly to PDF. No more having to paste the capture to a document to email unless I need to edit the capture in some way (like a map describing directions complete with red arrows). 
I haven't yet used many of the other features available but for the basic needs I use it for mostly, it works flawlessly.
nice app much like Greenshot on Windows but it stopped working on my 18.04 Ubuntu. Now the top bar icon is missing and starting it from the menu doesn't do anything.

Llevo varios años usándola y nunca me ha dado problemas. La recomiendo.
Para poder editar y demás cosas hace falta seguir instalando paquetes

Para solucionar el problema deben cambiar la configuracion de la session
en el archivo /etc/gdm/custom.conf descomentar WaylandEnable=false
luego adicionar en la sigueinte linea de la seccion daemon del mismo archivo 
DefaultSession=gnome-xorg.desktop

guardar el archivo y reiniciar
